case_title: THE STATE vs RANA PHOOL MUHAMMAD KHAN AND OTHERS
respondent: RANA PHOOL MUHAMMAD KHAN AND OTHERS

key_issues.issue: Competency of the court to invoke suo motu revisional jurisdiction under section 13(1)(a) of the Consolidation of Holdings Ordinance, 1960 at a late stage.
key_issues.finding: Court has jurisdiction to invoke suo motu revisional powers despite the passage of time.

key_issues.issue: Requirement of Federal Government's prior approval for exchange of Trust land during consolidation proceedings.
key_issues.finding: Approval was not required; authority vested in the Evacuee Trust Property Board.

key_issues.issue: Fraud in the exchange of Trust land.
key_issues.finding: No evidence of fraud; exchange was conducted with consent of Board representatives.

key_issues.issue: Estoppel and waiver by the Evacuee Trust Property Board after accepting the exchanged land.
key_issues.finding: Board is barred by estoppel and waiver from seeking restoration of exchanged land.

facts.location: Mianke More (Bhai Phero), Tehsil Chunian, District Kasur

respondents: Consent of E.T.P. Board representatives validated the exchange.
Consolidation scheme confirmed 16 years ago; reopening is unjust.
federal_government: Trust land cannot be exchanged without Federal Government's approval.
Fraud vitiates the exchange and necessitates restoration.

reasoning: No fraud established in the exchange process.
Evacuee Trust Property Board consented to the exchange and accepted the land.
Significant improvements made on exchanged land over 16 years.
